w23b1gt51j.name: Yusof Ishak Mosque
w23b1gt51j.remarks: Masjid Yusof Ishak is the 71st mosque in Singapore today, and the fourth mosque built under Phase 4 [1] of the Mosque Building Programme. It is Singapore’s 26th mosque to be funded by the Mosque Building and Mendaki Fund (MBMF). Masjid Yusof Ishak is designed with a unique architecture blending traditional mosque characteristics with Nusantara heritage and elements, while also addressing functional requirements. Distinctive features of a tropical Nusantara house, such as eaves/overhangs, verandah, decorative fixed ventilation panels and beautifully crafted balustrades, are reinterpreted and expressed in a modern way befitting this new generation mosque.
